greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write 2*n = p + q with p, q and (p-1)*(q+1) - 1 all prime.
comment: This is stronger than Goldbach's conjecture for even numbers. It also implies A. Murthy's conjecture (cf. A109909) for even numbers.
We have verified the conjecture for n up to 2*10^7.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures involving primes and quadratic forms, preprint, arXiv:1211.1588 [math.NT], 2012-2015.
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_ and _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Oct 13 2013
